verses.verse: Then came <S%H935><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> to Nob <S%H5011><s%> to Ahimelech <S%H288><s%> the priest <S%H3548><s%>: and Ahimelech <S%H288><s%> came to meet <S%H7125><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> trembling <S%H2729><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H376><s%>, Why art thou alone, and no man with thee?

And David <S%H1732><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Ahimelech <S%H288><s%> the priest <S%H3548><s%>, The king <S%H4428><s%> hath commanded <S%H6680><s%> me a business <S%H1697><s%>, and hath said <S%H559><s%> unto me <S%H376><s%>, Let no man know <S%H3045><s%> anything <S%H3972><s%> of the business <S%H1697><s%> whereabout I send <S%H7971><s%> thee <S%H6680><s%>, and what I have commanded thee <S%H6680><s%>: and I have appointed the young men <S%H5288><s%> to such <S%H6423><s%> and such <S%H492><s%> a place <S%H4725><s%>.

Now therefore what is <S%H3426><s%> under thy hand <S%H3027><s%>? give <S%H5414><s%> me five <S%H2568><s%> loaves of bread <S%H3899><s%> in my hand <S%H3027><s%>, or whatsoever there is present <S%H4672><s%>.

And the priest <S%H3548><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, There is no common <S%H2455><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> under my hand <S%H3027><s%>, but there is <S%H3426><s%> holy <S%H6944><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%>; if only the young men <S%H5288><s%> have kept <S%H8104><s%> themselves from <S%H389><s%> women <S%H802><s%>.

And David <S%H1732><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> the priest <S%H3548><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H518><s%>, Of a truth women <S%H802><s%> have been kept <S%H6113><s%> from us about these three <S%H8032><s%> days <S%H8543><s%>; when I came out <S%H3318><s%>, the vessels <S%H3627><s%> of the young men <S%H5288><s%> were holy <S%H6944><s%>, though it was but a common <S%H2455><s%> journey <S%H1870><s%>; how much more then to-day <S%H3117><s%> shall their vessels <S%H3627><s%> be holy <S%H6942><s%>?

So the priest <S%H3548><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> him holy <S%H6944><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%>; for there was no bread there but the showbread <S%H3899><s%>, that was taken <S%H5493><s%> from before <S%H6440><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, to put <S%H7760><s%> hot <S%H2527><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> when it was taken away <S%H3947><s%>.

Now a certain man <S%H376><s%> of the servants <S%H5650><s%> of Saul <S%H7586><s%> was there that day <S%H3117><s%>, detained <S%H6113><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>; and his name <S%H8034><s%> was Doeg <S%H1673><s%> the Edomite <S%H130><s%>, the chiefest <S%H47><s%> of the herdsmen <S%H7462><s%> that belonged to Saul <S%H7586><s%>.

And David <S%H1732><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Ahimelech <S%H288><s%>, And is there <S%H3426><s%> not <S%H371><s%> here under thy hand <S%H3027><s%> spear <S%H2595><s%> or sword <S%H2719><s%>? for I have neither brought <S%H3947><s%> my sword <S%H2719><s%> nor my weapons <S%H3627><s%> with me <S%H3027><s%>, because the king <S%H4428><s%>'s business <S%H1697><s%> required <S%H1961><s%> haste <S%H5169><s%>.

And the priest <S%H3548><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, The sword <S%H2719><s%> of Goliath <S%H1555><s%> the Philistine <S%H6430><s%>, whom thou slewest <S%H5221><s%> in the vale <S%H6010><s%> of Elah <S%H425><s%>, behold <S%H3874><s%>, it is here wrapped in a cloth <S%H8071><s%> behind <S%H310><s%> the ephod <S%H646><s%>: if thou wilt take <S%H3947><s%> that <S%H3947><s%>, take it <S%H312><s%>; for there is no other save <S%H2108><s%> that here <S%H2088><s%>. And David <S%H1732><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, There is none like that <S%H5414><s%>; give it me.

And David <S%H1732><s%> arose <S%H6965><s%>, and fled <S%H1272><s%> that day <S%H3117><s%> for fear <S%H6440><s%> of Saul <S%H7586><s%>, and went <S%H935><s%> to Achish <S%H397><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Gath <S%H1661><s%>.

And the servants <S%H5650><s%> of Achish <S%H397><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H1732><s%>, Is not this David the king <S%H4428><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>? did they not sing <S%H6030><s%> one to another of him <S%H2088><s%> in dances <S%H4246><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Saul <S%H7586><s%> hath slain <S%H5221><s%> his thousands <S%H505><s%>, And David <S%H1732><s%> his ten thousands <S%H7233><s%>?

And David <S%H1732><s%> laid up <S%H7760><s%> these words <S%H1697><s%> in his heart <S%H3824><s%>, and was sore <S%H3966><s%> afraid <S%H3372><s%> of <S%H6440><s%> Achish <S%H397><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Gath <S%H1661><s%>.

And he changed <S%H8138><s%> his behavior <S%H2940><s%> before <S%H5869><s%> them <S%H1984><s%>, and feigned himself mad in their hands <S%H3027><s%>, and scrabbled <S%H8427><s%> on the doors <S%H1817><s%> of the gate <S%H8179><s%>, and let his spittle <S%H7388><s%> fall down <S%H3381><s%> upon his beard <S%H2206><s%>.
Then said <S%H559><s%> Achish <S%H397><s%> unto his servants <S%H5650><s%>, Lo <S%H7200><s%>, ye see the man <S%H376><s%> is mad <S%H7696><s%>; wherefore then have ye brought him to me <S%H935><s%>?

Do I lack <S%H2638><s%> madmen <S%H7696><s%>, that ye have brought <S%H935><s%> this fellow to play the madman <S%H7696><s%> in my presence <S%H935><s%>? shall this fellow come into my house <S%H1004><s%>?
